About

here’s my instagram

here’s my twitter

and if you’re my mom, here’s my pinterest

Hi! I am a graduate student at UCSF studying biomedical informatics. Before coming to UCSF, I studied at Brandeis University, where I majored in biological physics and art history.

At Brandeis, I worked in the Rosbash lab where I studied circadian rhythms. My honors thesis, entitled Bioinformatic approaches to chromatin structure and RNA editing in Drosophila can be found here if you’re that kind of a nerd.

My scientific interests now fall broadly in epigenetics and the control of complex traits. Currently, I’m working on this in the Zaitlen lab.

Besides science, I am interested in art and design. My favorite museums include the Isabella Stewart Gardner in Boston, the RISD Museum in Providence, the Brooklyn Museum in NYC, and the Asian Art Museum here in SF. Recently, I’ve been getting into Islamic art and architecture (the Met has cool examples of this).

This website is going to be an agglomeration of things, including but not limited to: reviews of french fries in the Bay Area, art I’ve made or liked, and cool science graphs.

Please enjoy this website to the fullest extent of the law.
